Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, and depict them distinctly.
The student can draw and label various types of plants common to each habitat, such as trees on land and seaweed in water.
The student can draw and label different types of animals, like fish in the water and birds on land.
The student can demonstrate the diversity of life by including a variety of living things, though may not exhaustively show all possibilities.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label some plants or animals, missing a few labels or mixing them up (e.g., wrongly labeling a fish as a bird).
The student may overlook subtle comparisons or contrasts between habitats (e.g., fails to highlight differences in plant density).
The student might miss or simplify patterns of diversity, such as showing only a couple of animal types in each habitat instead of a broader range.
